ID.title: Series ID
ID.description: The series ID the show belongs to.

name.title: Content Name
name.description: The friendly, human-readable name of the timed media asset.

length.title: Media Content Length
length.description: Length of primary media asset in seconds.

contentType.title: Broadcast Content Type
contentType.description: The type of the stream delivery.

channel.title: Content Channel
channel.description: Distribution channel from where the content was played.

sdkVersion.title: Version
sdkVersion.description: The version identifier of the API, e.g h.18.

assetID.title: Asset ID
assetID.description: Identifier of the content, which can be used to tie back to other industry or CMS IDs.

genre.title: Genre
genre.description: Type or grouping of content as defined by content producer.

firstAirDate.title: First Air Date
firstAirDate.description: The date when the content first aired on television.

firstDigitalDate.title: First Digital Date
firstDigitalDate.description: The date when the content first aired on any digital channel or platform.

rating.title: Rating Value
rating.description: Rating value as issued by the rating source.

showType.title: Show Type
showType.description: The type of content for example, trailer or full episode.

adLoad.title: Ad Load Type
adLoad.description: The type of ad loaded as defined by each customer's internal representation.

mvpd.title: MVPD Identifier
mvpd.description: The MVPD (Multichannel Video Programming Distributor) provided via authentication. [https://en.wikipedia.org/?title=MVPD]

auth.title: Media Authorized
auth.description: The user has been authorized via authentication.

dayPart.title: Day Part
dayPart.description: Defines the time of the day when the content was broadcast or played.

feed.title: Feed Type
feed.description: The type of feed, which can either represent actual feed-related data such as  EAST HD or SD, or the source of the feed like a URL.

streamFormat.title: Stream Format
streamFormat.description: Free-form format of the stream for example, short or long.

resume.title: Resume
resume.description: Marks each playback that was resumed after more than 30 minutes of buffer, pause, or stall period.

streamType.title: Stream Type
streamType.description: The type of the media stream.

artist.title: Artist
artist.description: The name of the album artist or group performing the music recording or video.

album.title: Album
album.description: The name of the album that the music recording or video belongs to.

station.title: Radio Station
station.description: The radio station name on which the audio is played.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: Name of the audio content publisher.

segment.title: Video Segment
segment.description: The interval that describes the part of the content that has been viewed in minutes.

isDownloaded.title: Media Downloaded Flag
isDownloaded.description: The stream was played locally on the device after being downloaded.

isFederated.title: Federated Data
isFederated.description: Set to true when the hit is federated (i.e., received by the customer as part of a federated data share, rather than their own implementation).

view.title: Media Starts
view.description: Load event for the media. (This occurs when the viewer clicks the Play button). This would count even if there are pre-roll ads, buffering, errors, and so on.

play.title: Content Starts
play.description: First frame of media is consumed. If the user drops during ad, buffering, etc., then there would be no “Content Start” event.

dropBeforeStarts.title: Drop Before Start
dropBeforeStarts.description: Indicates the user abandoned the media stream before the first frame for example, during the pre-roll ad break, or due to an error while loading the content from the CDN.

complete.title: Content Completes
complete.description: Indicates if a timed media asset was watched to completion, this does not necessarily mean the viewer watched the whole video; viewer could have skipped ahead.

timePlayed.title: Content Time Spent
timePlayed.description: Sums the event duration (in seconds) for all events of type PLAY on the main content. The value will be displayed in the time format (HH:MM:SS) in Analysis Workspace and Reports & Analytics. In Data Feeds, Data Warehouse, and Reporting APIs the values will be displayed in seconds.

totalTimePlayed.title: Media Time Spent
totalTimePlayed.description: Describes the total amount of time spent by a user on a specific timed media asset, which includes time spent watching ads.

uniqueTimePlayed.title: Unique Time Played
uniqueTimePlayed.description: Describes the sum of the unique intervals seen by a user on a timed media asset - i.e. the length playback intervals viewed multiple times are only counted once.

averageMinuteAudience.title: Average Minute Audience
averageMinuteAudience.description: Describes the average content time spent for a specific media item - i.e. the total content time spent divided by the length for all of the playback sessions.

adCount.title: Ad Count
adCount.description: The number of ads started during the playback.

chapterCount.title: Chapter Count
chapterCount.description: The number of chapters started during the playback.

progress10.title: 10% Progress Marker
progress10.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 10% marker of media based on stream length. The marker is only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

progress25.title: 25% Progress Marker
progress25.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 25% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

progress50.title: 50% Progress Marker
progress50.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 50% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

progress75.title: 75% Progress Marker
progress75.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 75% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

progress95.title: 95% Progress Marker
progress95.description: Indicates that the playhead passed the 95% marker of media based on stream length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.

estimatedStreams.title: Estimated Streams
estimatedStreams.description: The estimated number of video or audio streams per each individual content.

pause.title: Pause Impacted Streams
pause.description: Indicates if one or more pauses occurred during the playback of a single media item.

pauseCount.title: Pause Events
pauseCount.description: The number of pause periods that occurred during playback.

pauseTime.title: Total Pause Duration
pauseTime.description: Describes the duration in seconds in which playback was paused by the user.

segmentView.title: Media Segment Views
segmentView.description: Indicates when at least one frame, not necessarily the first has been viewed.

secondsSinceLastCall.title: Media Session Server Timeout
secondsSinceLastCall.description: Indicates the amount of time, in seconds, that passed between the user's last known interaction and the moment the session was closed.
